title: What to do if you've been sent a tax return
description:
Watch this video to find out what you need to do if you've been sent a tax return to complete. Including:
0:00 why you may be sent a return
0:16 how to check if you need a Self Assessment tax return
0:31 what to do when you're sent a return
0:41 what happens if you don't send a return on time
0:47 telling HMRC you no longer need to send a return
0:54 how to tell HMRC you've stopped being self-employed or left a partnership
1:07 help & support

title: Inside HMRC Estates: Meet Tom from Professional Services and Digital Estates
description:
After four years in the prison service, Tom made a career change in 2018, joining HMRC with expectations of working primarily on tax-related tasks. However, the reality was far more exciting. Over the years, Tom has become a key player in estates analytics, helping drive digital innovation across HMRC’s estate. From implementing artificial intelligence and smart buildings to digital twin, Tom is part of a team responsible for shaping the future of HMRC's infrastructure. Visit Civil Service Jobs and search ‘HMRC’ to discover roles in property and estates.

00:00 – 00:12: Welcome to Professional Services and Digital Estate
00:12 – 1:34:  Meet Data Analyst, Tom
1:34 – 1:47: Apply on Civil Service Jobs

title: Inside HMRC Estates: Meet Mags from Programme and Project Delivery
description:
Join Mags, as she shares he journey as a Project Manager in HMRC's Project and Programme Delivery team. Since starting as a Helpline Officer in 2002, Mags has taken on large-scale projects, overseeing the transformation of HMRC workplaces across the UK. With a passion for mentoring and helping others, she reflects on her proudest moments, including guiding an apprentice to secure a full-time role. Watch to learn more about her rewarding career in the Civil Service and the impact she’s made along the way. Visit Civil Service Jobs and search ‘HMRC’ to discover roles in property and estates.

00:00 – 00:12: Welcome to Programme and Project Delivery
00:12 – 1:47: Meet Project Manager, Mags
1:47 – 2:02: Apply on Civil Service Jobs

title: Inside HMRC Estates: Meet Rich from Service Design and User Experience
description:
Rich shares his journey of joining HMRC five years ago with no prior experience in Service Design and User Experience. HMRC believed in his skills, allowing him to build a team focused on real-life user experiences across its 14 Regional Centres. From redesigning workspaces to incorporating innovative solutions like AV kits, Rich’s team is committed to improving the work environment for 60,000+ users. Discover how Rich and his team are transforming HMRC spaces through feedback and innovation. Visit Civil Service Jobs and search ‘HMRC’ to discover roles in property and estates.

00:12 – 1:57: Meet Head of User Experience, Rich

title: Voluntary and Community Sector Grant Funding Programme: Meet The Experts
description:
Discover how HMRC's Voluntary and Community Sector Grant Funding Programme is making a real difference for individuals in need of support. From navigating complex benefit claims to managing debt, learn how this vital funding empowers charities to deliver crucial services to vulnerable people across the UK. In this video, experts from Citizens Advice, the Royal Association for Deaf People, and Business Debtline share their powerful stories and experiences.
 

00:23 - Paul, Citizens Advice East Lancashire
01:12 - Sarah, Royal Association for Deaf People
01:59 - Sati, Business Debtline

Citizens Advice: @CitizensAdviceEL 
Royal Association for Deaf People: @royaldeaf 
Business Debtline: @businessdebtline8667 

LINK TO GOV.UK guidance:
https://www.gov.uk/guidance/voluntary-and-community-sector-organisations-who-can-give-you-extra-support?utm_source=y.co_hmrcgovuk&utm_medium=social&utm_campaign=vcs

title: Tax Specialist Programme Graduate to HMRC Director: Nicole’s rewarding career journey
description: Nicole Newbury, one of HMRC's directors, shares her inspiring career journey after completing the Tax Specialist Programme (TSP). In this video, she highlights the diverse roles she has undertaken, from investigating tax discrepancies and advising ministers on tax law to representing HMRC at the Houses of Parliament and working internationally to help develop tax systems in countries like Ghana. Ready to take the next step in your career? Applications open on Civil Service Jobs on 27 September 2024.

title: Inside HMRC Estates: Meet our Corporate Capabilities team
description:
Hear from Claudie and Jill as they share their journey working in HMRC's Estates and Locations Programme. Learn about the transformational changes happening across the HMRC estate, including modern regional centres and government hubs across the UK. Find out how our supportive, people-focused environment helps employees grow and succeed, with incredible investment in professional development. Visit Civil Service Jobs and search ‘HMRC’ to apply for roles in property and estates.

title: Inside HMRC Estates: Meet the Operational Contract Management and Support Services team
description:
Are you ready to be part of the team that ensures safety, sustainability, and statutory compliance within HMRC buildings across the UK? Hear from Nicole, Adam and Margaret who have advanced their careers in the Estates team, from managing essential contracts to supporting net-zero initiatives. Whether you're passionate about security, operational contracts, or facilities management, you'll find a rewarding and dynamic career path within HMRC Estates. Visit Civil Service Jobs and search ‘HMRC’ to apply for roles in property and estates.

title: Inside HMRC Estates: Meet our Property and Assets team
description:
Discover the journey of Parveen and Kevin in HMRC's Property and Assets team, whose inspiring career paths have led them to their leadership positions today. Learn how HMRC offers diverse opportunities, professional development, and a supportive environment, enabling you to thrive and make a difference. If you’re ambitious and ready to grow your career, visit Civil Service Jobs and search ‘HMRC’ to discover roles in property and estates.

title: Take your career to new heights with HMRC's Tax Specialist Programme
description: Are you looking to take your career to new heights? HMRC’s Tax Specialist Programme (TSP) offers a unique opportunity to develop your skills and become an expert in tax. Whether you're a recent graduate or an existing Civil Servant, this programme is designed to challenge and reward you, giving you the tools to handle complex tax issues and influence some of the most important financial decisions in the UK. The vacancy goes live on Friday 27th September on Civil Service Jobs, so mark your calendars and get ready to apply!

title: HMRC Tax Specialist Programme: Your path to a rewarding career in tax
description: Looking for a meaningful career where you can make a difference? Jim Harra, Permanent Secretary at His Majesty's Revenue and Customs (HMRC), invites you to apply for the Tax Specialist Programme. As part of the world's leading tax authority, you'll have the opportunity to reduce the tax gap, tackle tax evasion, and secure vital funds for public services. This programme offers early responsibility, extensive support, and the chance to specialise in areas where your skills can truly shine. At HMRC, we’re committed to creating an inclusive workplace where everyone feels respected and valued. Ready to take the next step in your career? Applications open on Civil Service Jobs on 27 September 2024.

title: Inside HMRC Estates: Meet our Workplace Operations team
description:
Discover what it's like to work in the Workplace Operations team at HMRC. Join Eddie, a Building Manager in Belfast, and Chanice, a Customer Service Officer in Birmingham, as they share their unique career journeys and the vital roles they play in maintaining safe, secure and modern workspaces for HMRC colleagues. From diverse career backgrounds to exceptional work-life balance, explore how they help shape the future of HMRC estates. Visit Civil Service Jobs and search 'HMRC' to discover roles in property and estates.

title: Inside HMRC Estates: The Government Property Profession
description:
Join us as we delve into the world of Government Property Profession, a vibrant network of over 7,000 property professionals committed to making property better across government. In this video, meet Jake, Deputy Head of the Property Profession at the Office of Government Property, and Andrew, Head of Estates People and Capability at HMRC, as they share insights into how they manage and support one of the UK's largest and most diverse estates.

Discover how we're creating a smaller, better, and greener estate by investing in our greatest asset - our people. Learn about existing career opportunities, professional development, and tailored learning routes that make government property a unique, challenging, and rewarding place to work. Whether you're an experienced professional or just starting out, there's a career in your hands. Visit Civil Service Jobs and search 'HMRC' to discover roles in property and estates.

title: How can I appeal a late filing penalty
description:
If you have received a penalty for filing your Self Assessment tax return late, this video will guide you through the appeal process. Including:
0:00 introduction
0:18 what we mean by a reasonable excuse for late filing
0:32 the 30-day window for appealing penalties
0:38 how to check if you need to send a tax return
1:08 multiple ways to submit your appeal such as: using your personal tax account, using the appeal form from your penalty notice, and by sending a letter (and what to include)
1:44 help & support
Watch this video to understand your rights and the steps to take when dealing with HMRC's late filing penalties.

*To subscribe and visit the HMRCgovuk YouTube home page:*
https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCX03s8aGilPqvp992meZd6w?sub_confirmation=1

title: How to set up a Time to Pay arrangement online for Self Assessment
description:
If you can't pay your Self Assessment tax bill in full, don’t worry – this video will guide you through setting up a Time to Pay arrangement online. 
By following these steps, you can create a payment plan that fits your financial situation without needing to call HMRC. 
We’ll walk you through: 
0:28 the process, from accessing the payment plan setup on GOV.UK 
2:08 to providing your income and expenses information 
4:15 finalising the arrangement
4:28 help & support
Remember, setting up a payment plan can help you avoid late payment penalties.

title: Climbing the career ladder: Ali’s successful 32-year career at HMRC
description:
Ever wondered if a fulfilling career, supportive workplace, and thriving personal life are all possible?  

Meet Ali, a Portfolio Director at HMRC.  

Ali has spent the past 32 years successfully climbing the career ladder. From the most junior grade to where she is now as a Senior Civil Servant. 

Discover how HMRC provided her with the learning, opportunities, and flexibility she needed to succeed, even while raising a child with special needs.

title: Customs clearance instructions for exports– Step 11 – how to complete the customs declaration
description:
This recorded webinar is step 11 of a series of short webinars taking you through the Customs Declaration Service guidance on completing an export declaration. The series follows Grayson who is exporting t-shirts from Great Britain to the USA. It follows the 11 steps set out on the ‘Navigate the CDS Declaration Instructions for Exports’ GOV.UK page. Step 11 is how to complete the customs declaration.
Please see other videos in this series in our Export playlist below:

title: Frugal Mum shares her hints and tips about applying for Child Benefit online
description:
Frugal Mum has partnered with HMRC to share exciting news about Child Benefit going digital. Since 1977, Child Benefit has been a financial boost for families. In this video, Frugal Mum walks you through the process, highlighting the ease and speed of the new online service at https://www.gov.uk/child-benefit/how-to-claim?&utm_source=y.co_hmrcgovuk&utm_medium=social&utm_campaign=childbenefitclaimonline&utm_content=frugalmum

https://www.gov.uk/guidance/download-the-hmrc-app?&utm_source=y.co_hmrcgovuk&utm_medium=social&utm_campaign=childbenefitclaimonline&utm_content=frugalmum

title: Santa Gets Ready to do his Self Assessment
description:
We’ve been filming with Santa to encourage customers to tick their tax return off their to do list before his annual visit on Sunday night. 
 
The Self Assessment deadline for the 2022 to 2023 tax year is 31 January 2024, but we’re encouraging customers to follow Santa’s lead and get ready in good time to prevent a last minute rush!

title: Craig Ogilvie on Making Tax Digital: The future of Tax
description:
Craig Ogilvie, HMRC's Making Tax Digital Programme Director, shares insights into the transformative journey of Making Tax Digital (MTD). With over 20 years at HMRC, Craig discusses MTD's critical role in reducing errors, modernising infrastructure, and meeting 21st-century expectations. Learn how MTD simplifies taxes, improves productivity, and addresses the tax gap.

title: What help can I get if I can’t pay my tax bill?
description:
If you’re struggling to pay your tax bill, HMRC is here to help. This video explains:
0:10 that we’ll look at your financial situation and how we can help
0:21 options for affordable payment plans
0:29 flexibility in changing arrangements if your circumstances change
0:35 support available for those facing health or personal difficulties
0:47 about free advice available through MoneyHelper for general debt concerns
1:01 help & support
Learn how HMRC can work with you to find a solution. Visit https://www.gov.uk/difficulties-paying-hmrc for more information or check out our other helpful videos on this channel.

title: Don’t miss out on a tax refund for work expenses
description:
HMRC is reminding workers to get the best deal when claiming a tax refund on work related expenses. 

Customers can use our online tool to check eligibility and a full list of work expenses they can claim for - including uniforms and work clothing. 

It is quick and easy to claim a tax refund directly through HMRC’s online portal, and the only way to guarantee receiving 100% of the repayment – with no small print and no middlemen taking a cut. 

Visit GOV.UK for more information and to make a claim 👇 

https://www.gov.uk/tax-relief-for-employees?&utm_source=y.co_hmrcgovuk&utm_medium=social&utm_campaign=informed_choice

title: Tax credits renewal packs are on their way
description:
Tax credits renewal packs are on their way – and will arrive with customers between 2 May and 15 June. 

There is no need to call us. Customers can renew their tax credits online via the HMRC App or GOV.UK. 

Download the HMRC app from the App Store.

title: 2023-24 Cost of Living payments
description:
From today until 9 May, the first 2023-24 #CostofLiving Payment of £301 will be paid automatically to eligible tax credit customers. 

If you think you're eligible but haven't received a payment, please wait until 16 May to contact us, to allow time for you payment to be processed.

In support of #DeafAwarenessWeek Dishan is here to help share this message.

To find out more visit https://www.gov.uk/guidance/cost-of-living-payment

title: Cost of Living Payment 2023-24
description:
@HMRCgovuk has announced the first 2023-24 #CostofLiving Payment of £301 for eligible customers on tax credits and no other qualifying benefits will be made between 2-9 May. You can check GOV.UK to see if you’re eligible 
  
🚫 No need to contact us or apply  
  
💸 It will be paid automatically into your bank account if you’re eligible 
  
ℹ More information is available on GOV.UK www.gov.uk/costoflivingpayments

title: Customs clearance instructions for imports – Step 7 – specific document and reference codes
description:
This recorded webinar is step 7 of a series of short webinars taking you through the Customs Declaration Service guidance on completing an import declaration. The series follows Hallie who is importing t-shirts from the USA to Great Britain. It follows the 10 steps set out on the ‘Navigate the CDS Declaration Instructions for Imports’ GOV.UK page. 

Step 7 is how to identify specific document and reference codes.

How to import goods into the UK: step by step

title: Beth yw treth? | Ffeithiau Treth
description:
Rydych chi fwy na thebyg wedi clywed am dreth, ond efallai nad ydych chi’n sicr beth ydyw neu sut mae’n gweithio. Rhan o’n swydd ni yn CThEF yw esbonio beth yw treth i bobl fel chi. Dyna pam rydym wedi creu’r gyfres fideo Ffeithiau Treth, i esbonio’r hanfodion i bobl ifanc 14 i 17 oed. Yn y fideo hwn, byddwch yn dysgu am TAW a Threth Incwm, a phryd y bydd yn rhaid i chi ddechrau talu.  

Gallwch ddarganfod rhagor o wybodaeth am dreth a gwaith CThEF ar wefan GOV.UK. Ewch i https://www.gov.uk/government/organisations/hm-revenue-customs

Mae gennym ragor o adnoddau ar gael trwy 
https://nationalschoolspartnership.com
https://www.tes.com

Cysylltwch â ni ar y cyfryngau cymdeithasol…

Twitter: https://twitter.com/HMRCgovuk
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/HMRC

title: Beth yw CThEF? | Ffeithiau Treth
description:
Yma yn CThEF, rydym yn bennaf adnabyddus am gasglu treth, ond rydym yn gwneud llawer mwy na hynny. Mae’r fideo hwn yn esbonio sut mae ein gwaith ni o fudd i’r DU a’i phobl mewn ffyrdd gwahanol. Dysgwch sut rydym yn helpu teuluoedd a phlant, ac yn diogelu’r amgylchedd. 

Gallwch ddarganfod rhagor o wybodaeth am dreth a gwaith CThEF ar wefan GOV.UK. Ewch i https://www.gov.uk/government/organisations/hm-revenue-customs

description:

description:
Ydych chi erioed wedi meddwl pam mae gennym drethi neu sut mae nhw’n gweithio? Bydd y fideo hwn yn eich helpu i ddeall o ble mae trethi’n dod a sut maen nhw’n cael eu defnyddio. Byddwch hefyd yn dysgu pryd y bydd yn rhaid i chi ddechrau talu treth. 

Dyma’r fideo cyntaf yn y gyfres Ffeithiau Treth Iau rydyn ni, CThEF, wedi’i chreu er mwyn helpu plant 8 i 13 oed i ddysgu am dreth.

title: Tax and HMRC | Junior Tax Facts
description:
At HMRC, it’s our job to collect tax from people and businesses in the UK. The third video in our Junior Tax Facts series explains how we work and how tax money is spent to make life better for people living in the UK. 

You can find out more about tax and the work we do at HMRC on the GOV.UK website. Visit https://www.gov.uk/government/organisations/hm-revenue-customs

We have even more materials available at:

title: Why do we have tax? | Junior Tax Facts
description:
Have you ever wondered why we have taxes or how they work? This video will help you understand where taxes came from and what they’re used for. You’ll also find out when you have to start paying tax too. 

This is the first video in our Junior Tax Facts series, made by us at HMRC to help children aged 8 to 13 learn about tax.

You can find out more about tax and the work we do at HMRC on the GOV.UK website. Visit https://www.gov.uk/government/organisations/hm-revenue-customs

title: Working for yourself | Tax Facts
description:
When you’re self-employed, the way you pay tax works a bit differently. There are also some important things you need to remember. It’s not complicated though – this final video in our Tax Facts series will set out what you need to know.  

You can find out more about tax and the work we do at HMRC on the GOV.UK website. Visit https://www.gov.uk/government/organisations/hm-revenue-customs

title: What is tax? | Tax Facts
description:
You’ve probably heard of tax but you might not be sure what it is or how it works. Part of our job at HMRC is to explain what tax is to people like you. That’s why we’ve made this Tax Facts video series to explain the essentials to 14 to 17 year olds. In this video, you can find out about VAT and Income Tax, and when you need to start paying.  

You can find out more about tax and the work we do at HMRC on the GOV.UK website. Visit https://www.gov.uk/government/organisations/hm-revenue-customs

We have even more materials available at https://nationalschoolspartnership.com and https://www.tes.com

title: How do I use the HMRC app to make a Self Assessment payment?
description:
Learn how to pay your Self Assessment tax bill using the free and secure HMRC app. This video takes you through the process step-by-step, showing you how to:
0:16 access your Self Assessment summary
0:26 view a breakdown of the payment due
0:34 make payments through online banking or your bank's app
1:14 use the app's automatic connection to your bank for secure transactions
1:39 set up quick sign-in methods for future use
1:47 how to get the app
1:53 help & support

Download the HMRC app from Google Play (Android) or the App Store (Apple) today:
 
App store for Apple products: https://apps.apple.com/app/apple-store/id514561561
 
Google Play for Android: https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=uk.gov.hmrc.ptcalc

To find out more about the HMRC app on GOV.UK. go to:  https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/the-official-hmrc-app/the-free-hmrc-app?utm_source=app&utm_medium=youtube&utm_campaign=app&utm_id=hmrc&utm_content=sa-payments
 
Next video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oXzjkDkPTrM&list=PL8EcnheDt1zghUiaV1UaupNJeBKri4wp-&index=5

For more videos on Self Assessment, visit https://www.youtube.com/@HMRCgovuk/playlists?view=50&shelf_id=1

To view more videos about the HMRC app go to:
https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL8EcnheDt1zjwKTTd3H96-9yb2wLI75AR

title: How to subscribe to the Customs Declaration Service
description:
This recorded webinar shows you how to subscribe to the Customs Declaration Service, how to create an account and what you'll need.

Please note: To report issues with electronic Customs Declaration Service submissions email: isbc.eoricontact@hmrc.gov.uk 

Visit GOV.UK to find out more about:

Importing goods into the UK
https://www.gov.uk/import-goods-into-uk

Delaying declarations for goods brought into Great Britain
https://www.gov.uk/guidance/delaying-declarations-for-eu-goods-brought-into-great-britain

CDS Declaration Completion Instructions for Imports
https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/cds-uk-trade-tariff-volume-3-import-declaration-completion-guide

How to apply to use simplified declarations for imports
https://www.gov.uk/guidance/using-simplified-declarations-for-imports
